 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאת‎</span> **pronoun feminine** see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span>. 

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> **demonstrative pronoun** and **adverb**; feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאת‎</span>, once <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאתָה‎</span>, [[Jer.26.6|Jer 26:6]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] (also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹה‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זוֺ‎</span>, q. v.); common  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זוּ‎</span> (q. v.): ==this, here== (the element <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ז‎</span> = <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> = <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is widely diffused in the Semitic languages, as a demonstrative particle, often acquiring, like English ***that***, German ***der, die, das***, the force of a relative. Thus 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶ‎</span> ***this*** (e.g. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קבר ז‎</span> ***this grave***), also sometimes <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זן‎</span>, feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זא‎</span>, comm. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אז‎</span> (see [[BDB#CIS|CIS]] I. i. 1:4; 1:5; 1:6; 1:12; 44:1; 88:2 etc.); Aramaic of Nineveh, Babylon, Têma, Egypt, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זי‎</span> as mark of the genitive [literally ***that of***] ([[BDB#CIS|CIS]] II. i. 1, 2, 3, 4, etc., 65, 69-71, 113, 114, 141, 142, etc.), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זנה‎</span> ***this*** (***ib.*** 113:22; 145 C<sup>2</sup>), feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זא‎</span> 113:15; 145 B<sup>5</sup>; Aramaic of Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ז‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זן‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זנה‎</span> ***this***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זי‎</span> ***which*** ([[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>Sendsch. 56</sup>); Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ze***</u></abbr>, ***this***, feminine <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***z¹***</u></abbr>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***za***</u></abbr>, ***who*** (masculine), also (like <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זִי‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דְּ‎</span> [see below]) in common use as a mark of the genitive; 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhDwAUAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAPABQAAAIphI+pF93LHGQwTPRu1CZ3q3iAuHEkGCZkp65o9I7LOcegJGGfE7crVwAAOw=="> **1.** standing alone: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***this one***, sometimes contemptuously (especially with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵת‎</span>), [[Gen.2.23|Gen 2:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָזֹאת יִקָּרֵא אִשָּׁה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי מֵאִישׁ לֻקֳּחָהזּֿאֹת‎</span>, [[Gen.5.29|Gen 5:29]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה יְנַחֲמֵנוּ ֗֗֗ ‎</span>, [[Gen.12.12|Gen 12:12]]; [[Gen.38.28|Gen 38:28]]; [[Exod.10.7|Exod 10:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מָתַי יִהְיֶה זֶה לָנוּ לְמוֺקֵשׁ‎</span>, [[1Sam.10.27|1Sam 10:27]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יּוֺשִׁיעֵנוּ זֶה‎</span> how shall ***this man*** save us ? [[Prov.24.12|Prov 24:12]]; [[Job.15.17|Job 15:17]]; [[Neh.2.2|Neh 2:2]]; [[Eccl.1.17|Eccl 1:17]]; [[Eccl.2.15|Eccl 2:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גם זה הבל‎</span> (so v[[Eccl.2.19|Eccl 2:19]] v[[Eccl.2.21|Eccl 2:21]] v[[Eccl.2.23|Eccl 2:23]] +), [[Eccl.7.18|Eccl 7:18]] (twice in verse); of a concrete object, [[Exod.30.31|Exod 30:31]]; [[2Kgs.4.43|2Kgs 4:43]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה אֶתֵּן זֶה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנֵי מֵאָה אִישׁ‎</span>: in late Hebrew, [[Neh.13.6|Neh 13:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּכָלזֶֿה‎</span> during all this, [[2Chr.32.9|2Chr 32:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחַר זֶה‎</span>; pointing forwards la [[2Chr.5.17|2Chr 5:17]] f., to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> [[Ps.56.10|Ps 56:10]] je [[Ps.22.21|Ps 22:21]]. (See also below, **6 g.**) 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** repeated <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶהזֶ֗֗֗ה‎</span>, ***this . . . that, the one . . . the other*** or (if indefinite) ***another***, [[Gen.29.27|Gen 29:27]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאת‎</span>), [[Exod.14.20|Exod 14:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלֹא קָרַב זֶה אֶל זֶה‎</span>, [[1Kgs.3.23|1Kgs 3:23]]; [[1Kgs.22.20|1Kgs 22:20]]; [[Isa.6.3|Isa 6:3]]; [[Isa.44.5|Isa 44:5]] (3 t.), [[Ps.75.8|Ps 75:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה יַשְׁפִּיל וְזֶה יָרִים‎</span>, <ref ref="Job 1:16-18" b="18" cBegin="1" vBegin="16" cEnd="1" vEnd="18" onclick="bcv(18,1,16)">Job 1:16-18</ref>; [[Job.21.23|Job 21:23]]; [[Job.21.25|Job 21:25]] +.


**2.** In apposition to a substantive: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** preceding it (rare) [[Exod.32.1|Exod 32:1]]; [[Exod.32.23|Exod 32:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה משֶׁה‎</span>, [[Judg.5.5|Judg 5:5]] (= [[Ps.68.9|Ps 68:9]]) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה סִינַי‎</span> ***this*** Sinai, [[Josh.9.12|Josh 9:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה לַחְמֵנוּ‎</span> ***this*** our bread, [[1Kgs.14.14|1Kgs 14:14]]; [[2Kgs.6.33|2Kgs 6:33]]; [[Isa.23.13|Isa 23:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה הָעָם‎</span>, [[Ps.34.7|Ps 34:7]]; [[Ps.49.14|Ps 49:14]]; [[Ps.104.25|Ps 104:25]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה הים גדול וג‎</span> ***this*** sea ***there*** is great and broad, [[Ps.118.20|Ps 118:20]]; [[Song.7.8|Song 7:8]]; [[Ezra.3.12|Ezra 3:12]]. (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זוּ‎</span> [[Hab.1.11|Hab 1:11]].) 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** following it: — ***(a)*** when the substantive is determined by a pronominal affix, [[Gen.24.8|Gen 24:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁבוּעָתִי זֹאת‎</span>, ***this*** my oath, [[Deut.5.16|Deut 5:16]] O that <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבָבָם זֶה‎</span> ***this their*** ***heart*** (their present temper) might continue always! [[Deut.21.20|Deut 21:20]]; [[Josh.2.14|Josh 2:14]]; [[Josh.2.20|Josh 2:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דְּבָרֵנוּ זֶה‎</span>, [[Judg.6.14|Judg 6:14]] go <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּכֹחֲךָ זֶה‎</span> in ***this*** thy strength, [[Dan.10.17|Dan 10:17]]; [[2Chr.24.18|2Chr 24:18]]. (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵלֶּה‎</span>, 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.**) ==Rarely when it is undetermined==, [[2Kgs.1.2|2Kgs 1:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֳלִי זֶה‎</span> (so [[2Kgs.8.8|2Kgs 8:8]]; [[2Kgs.8.9|2Kgs 8:9]]), [[Ps.80.15|Ps 80:15]] (<span class="bdbLangGreek">β</span>) with the article, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַזֶּה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַזּאֹת‎</span>, after a substantive determined also by the article, [[Gen.7.1|Gen 7:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּדּוֺר הַזֶּה‎</span>, v[[Gen.7.13|Gen 7:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיּוֺם הַזֶּה‎</span>, [[Gen.12.7|Gen 12:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָאָרֶץ הַזּאֹת‎</span>, [[Gen.15.7|Gen 15:7]]; [[Gen.17.21|Gen 17:21]]; [[Gen.17.23|Gen 17:23]]; [[Deut.4.6|Deut 4:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הגוי הגדול הזה‎</span>, and continually. Not however after a proper name, except such as are construed with the article, as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיַּרְדֵּן הַזֶּה‎</span> [[Gen.32.11|Gen 32:11]]; [[Deut.3.27|Deut 3:27]]; [[Deut.31.2|Deut 31:2]]; [[Josh.1.2|Josh 1:2]]; [[Josh.1.11|Josh 1:11]]; [[Josh.4.22|Josh 4:22]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלְּבָנוֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַזֶּה‎</span> [[Josh.1.4|Josh 1:4]], compare [[Num.27.12|Num 27:12]] = [[Deut.32.49|Deut 32:49]] ([[2Kgs.5.20|2Kgs 5:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַזֶּה‎</span> belongs to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָאֲרַמִּי‎</span>): and hardly ever ([[2Chr.1.10|2Chr 1:10]] after a noun with a pronominal affix ([[Josh.2.17|Josh 2:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִשְּׁבֻעָתֵךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַזֶּה‎</span> the gender of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הזה‎</span> shews that the text is in error: see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 209</sup> ***Obs.***).


**3.** More oft. as predicate, as [[1Sam.24.17|1Sam 24:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲקוֺלְךָ זֶה‎</span>, [[2Kgs.3.23|2Kgs 3:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּם זֶה‎</span> ***this*** is blood, [[2Kgs.9.37|2Kgs 9:37]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאת אִיזָָֽבֶל׃‎</span>, [[Ezek.5.5|Ezek 5:5]] etc.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲזֶה‎</span> [[Isa.14.16|Isa 14:16]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲזֹאת‎</span> [[Isa.23.7|Isa 23:7]]; [[Lam.2.15|Lam 2:15]] often at the beginning or close of enumerations (especially [[BDB#P|P]]), descriptions, injunctions, etc., as [[Gen.5.1|Gen 5:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה ספר‎</span> ***this*** is the book . . ., [[Gen.9.12|Gen 9:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֹאת אוֺת הַבְּרִית‎</span>, [[Gen.17.10|Gen 17:10]]; [[Gen.20.13|Gen 20:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה חַסְדֵּךְ אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשִׂי עִמָּדִי‎</span>, [[Lev.6.2|Lev 6:2]]; [[Lev.6.13|Lev 6:13]]; [[Lev.6.18|Lev 6:18]]; [[Lev.7.1|Lev 7:1]]; [[Lev.7.11|Lev 7:11]];  [[Lev.33.1|Lev 33:1]];    etc.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה הדבר אשׁר ֗֗֗ ‎</span> [[Exod.16.16|Exod 16:16]]; [[Exod.35.4|Exod 35:4]];   [[Exod.21.11|Exod 21:11]];  [[Jer.38.21|Jer 38:21]] +, compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה אשׁר ֗֗֗ ‎</span> ***this*** is what (***or*** how) . . . [[Gen.6.15|Gen 6:15]]; [[Exod.29.38|Exod 29:38]]; [[Jer.33.16|Jer 33:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה לְךָ הָאוֺת‎</span> [[Exod.3.12|Exod 3:12]]; [[1Sam.2.34|1Sam 2:34]] +; at the end, [[Lev.7.37|Lev 7:37]]; [[Lev.11.46|Lev 11:46]]; [[Lev.13.50|Lev 13:50]]; [[Num.5.21|Num 5:21]]; [[Num.7.17|Num 7:17]]; [[Num.7.23|Num 7:23]] etc., [[Josh.19.8|Josh 19:8]]; [[Josh.19.16|Josh 19:16]]; [[Josh.19.23|Josh 19:23]] etc., [[Isa.14.26|Isa 14:26]]; [[Isa.16.13|Isa 16:13]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר ֗֗֗ ‎</span>), [[Isa.17.14|Isa 17:14]]; [[Isa.54.17|Isa 54:17]]; [[Jer.13.25|Jer 13:25]]; [[Ps.109.20|Ps 109:20]]; [[Song.5.16|Song 5:16]] (twice in verse); [[Job.5.27|Job 5:27]], in the latter case sometimes with the force of ***such*** (i.e. such as has been described), [[Job.18.21|Job 18:21]]; [[Job.20.29|Job 20:29]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵלֶּה‎</span> [[Ps.73.12|Ps 73:12]]), [[Ps.24.6|Ps 24:6]]; [[Ps.48.15|Ps 48:15]] ***such*** (= such a one) is God, our God, for ever ([[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#De|De]]) [[Zeph.2.15|Zeph 2:15]] compare [[Job.14.3|Job 14:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַףעַֿלזֶֿה‎</span> upon one ***such as this*** ([[Job.14.1|Job 14:1]] v[[Job.14.2|Job 14:2]]) dost thou open thy eyes?


**4.** It is attached enclitically, almost as an adverb, to certain words, especially interrogative pronouns, to impart, in a manner often not reproducible in English idiom, directness and force, bringing the question or statement made into close relation with the speaker. (Contrast from this point of view <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מי זה‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מי הוא‎</span>: see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הוא‎</span> **4 b.** Thus 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵיזֶֿה‎</span><sub>15</sub> where, ***then ?*** [[Job.28.12|Job 28:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵיזֶֿה מְקוֺם בִּינָה‎</span>, v[[Job.28.20|Job 28:20]]; [[Job.38.19|Job 38:19]] b (see other examples below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַי‎</span> **1 b**, p. 32). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִיזֶֿה‎</span>, [[1Sam.17.55|1Sam 17:55]]; [[1Sam.17.56|1Sam 17:56]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֶּןמִֿיזֶֿ֖ה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָעָֽלֶם׃‎</span> the son of ***whom, here***, is the lad ? [[Jer.49.19|Jer 49:19]] (= [[Jer.50.44|Jer 50:44]]) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמִי זֶה רֹעֶה אֲשֶׁר וג‎</span> and ***who*** (emphatic) is the shepherd that etc., [[Lam.3.37|Lam 3:37]]; [[Ps.24.8|Ps 24:8]] ***Who*** is the king of glory ? (for which in v[[Ps.24.10|Ps 24:10]] the stronger <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי הוּא זֶה‎</span> is said: so [[Jer.30.21|Jer 30:21]]; [[Esth.7.5|Esth 7:5]]), [[Esth.25.12|Esth 25:12]]. Elsewhere, the rend. ***Who*** is ***this . . .*** is admissible: [[Isa.63.1|Isa 63:1]]; [[Jer.46.7|Jer 46:7]]; [[Job.38.2|Job 38:2]]; [[Job.42.3|Job 42:3]] compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִיזֹֿאת‎</span> [[Song.3.6|Song 3:6]]; [[Song.6.10|Song 6:10]]; [[Song.8.5|Song 8:5]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזֶֿה‎</span> ***how, now ?*** [[Gen.27.20|Gen 27:20]]; [[Judg.18.24|Judg 18:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמַהזֶּֿה תּאֹמְרוּ אֵלַי‎</span> and ***how, now***, do ye say to me . . . ? [[1Kgs.21.5|1Kgs 21:5]]; [[2Kgs.1.5|2Kgs 1:5]] ***what, now ?*** (<span class="bdbLangGreek">τίποτε</span>;) [[1Sam.10.11|1Sam 10:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזֶּֿה הָיָה לְבֶןקִֿישׁ‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלמַֿהאזֶּה‎</span> ***for what ?*** [[Neh.2.4|Neh 2:4]]: contracted into <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַזֶּה‎</span> [[Exod.4.2|Exod 4:2]]. (compare Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָדֵין‎</span> ***why ?*** <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhLgAdAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAuAB0AAAJvhI+py+1/goS0Rjlbtg9j93HgF2ihOAKluaKa0S6bS6v1jdMzvOeJh/DEfL+QsEe8nE7B4aXoVMaYKmp1c2QIedBjlucNf6VibPmsOFNJWSMSaIm6rCAiXYuc59N71D2dBBbI8TfIJ2eYqLjIiFAAADs="> used as a conjunction ***therefore***, e.g. [[2Sam.18.22|2Sam 18:22]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]], [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>2013: both formed similarly</sup>.) 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזּֿאֹת‎</span> in the phrase (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲשִׂיתֶם‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָשִׂית‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזּֿאֹת עָשִׂיתָ‎</span> [[Gen.3.13|Gen 3:13]]; [[Gen.12.18|Gen 12:18]]; [[Gen.26.10|Gen 26:10]]; [[Gen.29.25|Gen 29:25]]; [[Gen.42.28|Gen 42:28]]; [[Exod.14.11|Exod 14:11]]; [[Judg.2.2|Judg 2:2]]; [[Judg.15.11|Judg 15:11]] +. Either ***What, now***, hast thou (have ye) done ? ([[BDB#Fl|Fl]] [[BDB#De|De]]) or ***what*** is ***this*** (that) thou hast (ye have) done ? (The Arabic grammarians dispute on the precise construction of the corresponding phrase in Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; [[BDB#De|De]]<sup>[[Gen.3.13|Gen 3:13]] (ed. 4)</sup>, and especially [[BDB#Fl|Fl]]<sup>Kl Schr. i. 356</sup> [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>p. 948</sup>.) 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמָּהזֶּֿה‎</span> ***wherefore, now ?*** [[Gen.18.13|Gen 18:13]]; [[Gen.25.22|Gen 25:22]]; [[Gen.32.30|Gen 32:30]]; [[Exod.5.22|Exod 5:22]]; [[Num.11.20|Num 11:20]] + often compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhMQAdAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAxAB0AAAJ4hI+py+0PozShzgurDrgz7UXcN16lU1pkpy7bAbqn1CJvUttn7q59s5vJMEIbq4hCApRA5vCDcy5ZTZ1TqlDmYlBiNYrq/p64ZJZraQlHKeYmzQG92dvl/DHP288kLs3uFyIYKFhoePiFSHSjOMHY6AgpOUlZyVAAADs="> **feminine** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַאַתָּה זֶה‎</span> [[2Sam.2.20|2Sam 2:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎האתה זה עשׂהאל‎</span> Art thou Asahel ? [[1Kgs.18.7|1Kgs 18:7]]; [[1Kgs.18.17|1Kgs 18:17]], without <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲ‎</span> [[Gen.27.24|Gen 27:24]] in an indirect question [[Gen.27.21|Gen 27:21]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **g.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנֵּה זֶה‎</span> ***behold, here . . .*** [[1Kgs.19.5|1Kgs 19:5]] (in narrative), [[Isa.21.9|Isa 21:9]]; [[Song.2.8|Song 2:8]]; [[Song.2.9|Song 2:9]]. compare [[Num.13.17|Num 13:17]] (unusual) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲלוּ זֶה בַּנֶּגֶבּ‎</span> go up ***here*** in the South. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **h.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַתָּה זֶה‎</span>, [[1Kgs.17.24|1Kgs 17:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַתָּה זֶה יָדַעְתִּי‎</span> ***now*** I know that . . ., [[2Kgs.5.22|2Kgs 5:22]] ***just now.*** Also 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **i.** prefixed to expressions denoting a period of time: [[Gen.27.36|Gen 27:36]] he hath supplanted me <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה פַעֲמַיִם‎</span> ***now*** two times (so [[Gen.43.10|Gen 43:10]]), [[Gen.31.38|Gen 31:38]] ***now, already*** twenty years, v[[Gen.31.41|Gen 31:41]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶהלִּֿי ֗֗֗ ‎</span>, [[Gen.45.6|Gen 45:6]]; [[Num.14.22|Num 14:22]] ***now*** ten times, [[Num.22.28|Num 22:28]]; [[Num.22.32|Num 22:32]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה שָׁלשׁ רְגָלִים‎</span>, [[Deut.8.2|Deut 8:2]]; [[Deut.8.4|Deut 8:4]]; [[Josh.22.3|Josh 22:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה יָמִים רַבִּים‎</span>, [[2Sam.14.2|2Sam 14:2]] +; [[Zech.7.3|Zech 7:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה כַּמָּה שָׁנִים‎</span> ***already*** how many years! compare [[Ruth.2.7|Ruth 2:7]].


**5.** In poetry, as a ***relative*** pronoun (rare: but see also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זוֺ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זוּ‎</span>): [[Ps.74.2|Ps 74:2]] the hill of Zion <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה שׁכנת בּוֺ‎</span> ***wherein*** thou dwellest, [[Ps.78.54|Ps 78:54]]; [[Ps.104.8|Ps 104:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלמְֿקום זה‎</span> to the place (***stative construct*** [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:130»§ 130</sup>. 3) ***which . . .*** v[[Ps.78.26|Ps 78:26]]; [[Prov.23.22|Prov 23:22]]; [[Isa.25.9|Isa 25:9]] = ***that which*** [[Job.15.17|Job 15:17]], ***those who*** [[Job.19.19|Job 19:19]] (so once, [[Exod.13.8|Exod 13:8]], even in prose). In some of the passages cited the punctuators, by coupling <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה‎</span> with the preceding substantive, and separating it from what follows by a disj. accent (as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרֶֿזה‎</span>), appear not to have recognised its relative sense, but to have construed, ***'this*** mountain, (which) thy right hand,' etc.


**6.** With prefixes (in special senses): — 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּזֶה‎</span><sub>15</sub> ***in this*** (place), ***here***, [[Gen.38.21|Gen 38:21]]; [[Gen.38.22|Gen 38:22]]; [[Exod.24.14|Exod 24:14]]; [[Num.23.1|Num 23:1]] (twice in verse); [[1Sam.1.26|1Sam 1:26]]; [[1Sam.9.11|1Sam 9:11]] +; of time, ***then***, [[Esth.2.13|Esth 2:13]]. Once <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּזֶה‎</span> [[1Sam.21.10|1Sam 21:10]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּזֹאת‎</span> ***(a) with this = on these conditions***, [[Gen.34.15|Gen 34:15]]; [[Gen.34.22|Gen 34:22]]; [[1Sam.11.2|1Sam 11:2]]; [[Isa.27.9|Isa 27:9]] = ***herewith, thus provided*** [[Lev.16.3|Lev 16:3]]. (<span class="bdbLangGreek">β</span>) ***by*** or ***through this*** (especially with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָדַע‎</span>), [[Gen.42.15|Gen 42:15]]; [[Gen.42.33|Gen 42:33]]; [[Exod.7.17|Exod 7:17]]; [[Num.16.28|Num 16:28]]; [[Josh.3.10|Josh 3:10]]; [[Ps.41.12|Ps 41:12]] so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּזֹאת‎</span> [[Mal.3.10|Mal 3:10]]. (<span class="bdbLangGreek">γ</span>) ***in spite of this***, [[Lev.26.27|Lev 26:27]]; [[Ps.27.3|Ps 27:3]], for which the fuller <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּכָלזֹֿאת‎</span> occurs, [[Isa.5.25|Isa 5:25]]; [[Isa.9.11|Isa 9:11]]; [[Isa.9.16|Isa 9:16]]; [[Isa.9.20|Isa 9:20]]; [[Isa.10.4|Isa 10:4]]; [[Ps.78.32|Ps 78:32]]; [[Jer.3.10|Jer 3:10]]; [[Hos.7.10|Hos 7:10]]. (<span class="bdbLangGreek">δ</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּזֹאת‎</span> ***for this cause*** (late style) [[1Chr.27.24|1Chr 27:24]]; [[2Chr.19.2|2Chr 19:2]] ***in this matter*** [[2Chr.20.17|2Chr 20:17]] 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּזֶה‎</span> 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) [[Gen.41.38|Gen 41:38]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲנִמְצָא כָזֶה אִישׁ אשׁר ֗֗֗ ‎</span>, [[Isa.56.12|Isa 56:12]]; [[Isa.58.5|Isa 58:5]]; [[Jer.5.9|Jer 5:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גּוֺי אֲשֶׁר כָּזֶה‎</span> (so v[[Jer.5.29|Jer 5:29]]; [[Jer.9.8|Jer 9:8]]). (<span class="bdbLangGreek">β</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּזֹה וְכָזֶה‎</span> ***thus and thus***, [[Judg.18.4|Judg 18:4]]; [[2Sam.11.25|2Sam 11:25]]; [[1Kgs.14.5|1Kgs 14:5]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּזֹאת‎</span> ***the like of this*** = ***as follows***, [[Gen.45.23|Gen 45:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּזֹאת‎</span> ***the like of this*** = ***things such as these*** [[Judg.13.23|Judg 13:23]] (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎השׁמיע‎</span>), [[Judg.15.7|Judg 15:7]]; [[Judg.19.30|Judg 19:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לא נראתה כָּזֹאת‎</span>, [[1Sam.4.7|1Sam 4:7]] (compare [[Jer.2.10|Jer 2:10]]; [[2Chr.30.26|2Chr 30:26]]), [[2Sam.14.13|2Sam 14:13]] (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חשׁב‎</span>), [[Isa.66.8|Isa 66:8]] (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁמע‎</span>), [[Ezra.7.27|Ezra 7:27]] = ***accordingly, to that effect*** (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּבֶּר‎</span>) [[2Chr.34.22|2Chr 34:22]] = ***in like manner*** [[Judg.8.8|Judg 8:8]] = ***thus*** (as has been described) [[1Kgs.7.37|1Kgs 7:37]]; [[1Chr.29.14|1Chr 29:14]]; [[2Chr.31.20|2Chr 31:20]]; [[2Chr.32.15|2Chr 32:15]]: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּזֹאת וְכָזֹאת‎</span> ***thus and thus*** [[Josh.7.20|Josh 7:20]]; [[2Sam.17.15|2Sam 17:15]] (twice in verse); [[2Kgs.5.4|2Kgs 5:4]]; [[2Kgs.9.12|2Kgs 9:12]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִזֶּה‎</span> ***from here, hence*** [[Gen.37.17|Gen 37:17]]; [[Gen.42.15|Gen 42:15]]; [[Gen.50.25|Gen 50:25]]; [[Exod.11.1|Exod 11:1]] (twice in verse); [[Exod.13.3|Exod 13:3]]; [[Deut.9.12|Deut 9:12]] + often: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִזֶּהמִ֗֗֗זֶּה‎</span> ***on one side . . . on the other side*** [[Exod.17.12|Exod 17:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מזה אחד ומזה אחד‎</span>, [[Exod.25.19|Exod 25:19]]; [[Exod.26.13|Exod 26:13]]; [[Exod.32.15|Exod 32:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מזה ומזה הם כתובים‎</span>, [[Num.22.24|Num 22:24]]; [[1Sam.14.4|1Sam 14:4]]; [[1Kgs.10.19|1Kgs 10:19]]; [[1Kgs.10.20|1Kgs 10:20]]; [[Zech.5.3|Zech 5:3]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִוֶּה וּמִזֶּה לְ‎</span> ***on one side and on the other side of . . .*** [[Exod.38.15|Exod 38:15]]; [[Josh.8.33|Josh 8:33]]; [[Ezek.45.7|Ezek 45:7]]; [[Ezek.48.21|Ezek 48:21]]. **feminine** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל זֶה‎</span> ***on this account*** (rare), [[Lam.5.17|Lam 5:17]] (pointing forwards), [[Esth.6.3|Esth 6:3]]. So <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל זֹאת‎</span> [[Amos.8.8|Amos 8:8]]; [[Mic.1.8|Mic 1:8]]; [[Jer.2.12|Jer 2:12]] ([[Job.17.8|Job 17:8]]) [[Jer.4.8|Jer 4:8]]; [[Jer.4.28|Jer 4:28]]; [[Ps.32.6|Ps 32:6]] in late prose [[Ezra.8.23|Ezra 8:23]]; [[Ezra.9.15|Ezra 9:15]]; [[Ezra.10.2|Ezra 10:2]]; [[Neh.13.14|Neh 13:14]]; [[2Chr.16.9|2Chr 16:9]]; [[2Chr.16.10|2Chr 16:10]]; [[2Chr.29.9|2Chr 29:9]]; [[2Chr.32.20|2Chr 32:20]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **g.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִם זֶה‎</span> ***in spite of this*** [[Neh.5.18|Neh 5:18]]. — On <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵי זֶה‎</span> ***which ?*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵי מִזֶּה‎</span> ***whence ?*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵי לָזֹאת‎</span> ***how ?*** see below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַי‎</span> **2**; and on <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלָּז‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלָּזֶה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלֵּזוּ‎</span>.


**Note.** — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> in [[1Sam.17.34|1Sam 17:34]] (in many editions) is a typographical error (not a [[BDB#Kt|Kt]]) of Jacob b. Chayim's Rabbinic Bible of 1525 for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂה‎</span> ***sheep***, which has been perpetuated hence in other subsequent editions. The reading of [[BDB#MSS|MSS]]. and of the best ancient editions is <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׂה‎</span> (compare de Rossi<sup>Var. Lect. ii. 151</sup>).
